message.content:
Validate ALL website pages in splice-website for SaaS release readiness.

Check each page exists and has proper content:
1. Landing page (src/app/page.tsx) - Hero, Features, Pricing, Testimonials, FAQ
2. Pricing page (src/app/pricing/page.tsx) - Full pricing display
3. Checkout pages:
   - src/app/checkout/page.tsx
   - src/app/checkout/success/page.tsx
   - src/app/checkout/cancel/page.tsx
4. Download page (src/app/download/page.tsx)
5. Login page (src/app/login/page.tsx)
6. Legal pages:
   - src/app/privacy/page.tsx
   - src/app/terms/page.tsx
   - src/app/refund/page.tsx
7. Documentation:
   - src/app/docs/page.tsx
   - src/app/docs/quickstart/page.tsx
   - src/app/docs/features/page.tsx
   - src/app/docs/faq/page.tsx
   - src/app/docs/api/page.tsx

Verify:
- All imports resolve correctly
- No TypeScript errors
- SEO metadata present
- Links work (internal navigation)
- Mobile responsiveness considerations

Report any missing or broken pages.

import { Metadata } from "next"; import { Header } from "@/components/landing/Header"; import { Footer } from "@/components/landing/Footer"; export const metadata: Metadata = { title: "Privacy Policy - SPLICE", description: "SPLICE privacy policy - how we collect, use, and protect your data.", }; export default function PrivacyPage() { return (

Privacy Policy

Last updated: December 27, 2025

1. Introduction

SPLICE ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our video editing plugin and related services.

2. Information We Collect

Account Information

  • Email address (required for account creation)
  • Payment information (processed securely by Stripe)
  • License key and subscription status

Usage Data

  • Processing hours used per billing cycle
  • Feature usage statistics (silence detection, music generation, etc.)
  • Error logs for troubleshooting

Audio/Video Data

Audio files are temporarily processed on our servers for transcription and analysis. We do not permanently store your audio or video content. All temporary files are automatically deleted after processing is complete.

3. How We Use Your Information

  • To provide and maintain our services
  • To process your subscription and payments
  • To send you service-related communications
  • To improve our products and services
  • To comply with legal obligations

4. Data Sharing

We do not sell your personal information. We may share data with:

  • Stripe: For payment processing
  • OpenAI: For transcription services (audio is not retained)
  • Cloud providers: For secure data storage and processing

5. Data Security

We implement industry-standard security measures including:

  • TLS encryption for all data in transit
  • Encrypted storage for sensitive data
  • Regular security audits and updates
  • Access controls and authentication

6. Your Rights

You have the right to:

  • Access your personal data
  • Correct inaccurate data
  • Request deletion of your data
  • Export your data
  • Opt out of marketing communications

7. Data Retention

We retain your account information for as long as your account is active. Usage logs are retained for 90 days. You may request deletion of your data at any time by contacting us.

8. Cookies

We use essential cookies for authentication and session management. We do not use tracking cookies or third-party advertising cookies.

9. Changes to This Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any material changes by email or through our services.

10. Contact Us

If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

Email: privacy@splice.app

Refund Policy

Last updated: December 27, 2025

14-Day Free Trial

All SPLICE subscription plans include a 14-day free trial. During this period, you have full access to all features included in your chosen plan. You will not be charged until your trial ends, and you can cancel at any time during the trial with no obligation.

7-Day Money-Back Guarantee

If you are not satisfied with SPLICE after your trial ends, you may request a full refund within 7 days of your first payment. No questions asked.

To request a refund, simply email us at support@splice.app with your account email address. Refunds are typically processed within 5-10 business days.

Subscription Cancellation

You may cancel your subscription at any time from your account settings or by contacting support. Upon cancellation:

  • You will retain access until the end of your current billing period
  • No additional charges will be made after cancellation
  • Unused credits do not roll over and are not refundable

Non-Refundable Items

The following are not eligible for refunds:

  • Payments made more than 7 days after the initial charge
  • Overage charges for usage beyond plan limits
  • Partial month refunds for mid-cycle cancellations
  • Accounts terminated for Terms of Service violations

Annual Subscriptions

Annual subscriptions are eligible for a prorated refund if cancelled within the first 30 days. After 30 days, annual subscriptions are non-refundable but you will retain access for the remainder of your subscription term.

Technical Issues

If you experience technical issues that prevent you from using SPLICE, please contact our support team first. We are committed to resolving technical problems and may offer extended trial periods or account credits as appropriate.

Contact Us

For refund requests or questions about this policy, please contact:

Email: support@splice.app

Please include your account email and the reason for your refund request. We aim to respond to all refund requests within 24-48 hours.

For more information, see our{" "} Terms of Service {" "} and{" "} Privacy Policy .

"use client"; import { motion } from "framer-motion"; import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; import { ArrowLeft, ArrowRight, Volume2, VolumeX, Mic, Music, Captions, Type, Smartphone, Users, Sparkles, Zap, LayoutGrid, FileText, Download, Youtube, Wand2, Clock, Target, } from "lucide-react"; import Link from "next/link"; import { Header } from "@/components/landing/Header"; import { Footer } from "@/components/landing/Footer"; const coreFeatures = [ { icon: VolumeX, title: "AI Silence Removal", description: "One click removes all awkward pauses and dead air. Your audience stays engaged from start to finish.", details: [ "Multiple detection methods for maximum accuracy", "Auto-threshold detection for optimal sensitivity", "30-second chunked processing for long files", "Adjustable sensitivity (0-100 slider)", "Preserves natural speech rhythm", ], badge: "Core", badgeColor: "bg-[#00D4FF]", }, { icon: Music, title: "AI Music Generation", description: "Generate custom background music that matches your video's mood, energy, and content.", details: [ "10 mood presets (upbeat, dramatic, chill, energetic, etc.)", "8 instrument presets (full-band, acoustic, electronic, etc.)", "30-180 second duration range", "Scene-aware generation from transcript", "3 variations per generation for selection", "Beat-aligned trimming to match video length", ], badge: "Pro", badgeColor: "bg-purple-500", }, { icon: Captions, title: "Animated Captions", description: "Create viral-style captions with word-by-word animations and keyword highlighting.", details: [ "5 built-in templates (MrBeast, Hormozi, Gaming, Corporate, Karaoke)", "AI-powered keyword detection", "Context-aware emoji insertion", "Export to MOGRT, ASS, SRT formats", "Customizable colors and timing", ], badge: "Pro", badgeColor: "bg-purple-500", }, { icon: Type, title: "Text-Based Editing", description: "Edit your video by editing the transcript. Delete text to delete video.", details: [ "Each word linked to video timecode", "LCS-based diff algorithm for accuracy", "Search and replace with timestamps", "Preview changes before applying", "50-level undo/redo stack", ], badge: "Pro", badgeColor: "bg-purple-500", }, { icon: Smartphone, title: "Social Reframe", description: "Automatically reframe your videos for any social platform with face tracking.", details: [ "Aspect ratios: 9:16, 1:1, 4:5, 16:9", "Platform presets: TikTok, Reels, Shorts, Instagram", "AI face detection and tracking", "Smooth motion path generation", "Safe zone visualization", ], badge: "Pro", badgeColor: "bg-purple-500", }, ]; const additionalFeatures = [ { icon: Users, title: "Multitrack Editing", description: "Analyze and auto-balance multi-speaker footage with intelligent switching.", details: ["2-4 speaker support", "Auto-balance screentime", "Wide shot integration", "Decision list export"], }, { icon: Mic, title: "Vocal Isolation", description: "Studio-quality AI vocal separation for clean audio in any environment.", details: ["Remove background noise", "Isolate dialogue", "Pro tier feature", "High-quality output"], }, { icon: Volume2, title: "Profanity Detection", description: "Detect and bleep profanity in multiple languages.", details: ["English, Spanish, French, German", "5 bleep types", "Custom blocklist", "Timeline insertion"], }, { icon: LayoutGrid, title: "Chapter Detection", description: "AI-powered topic segmentation with YouTube timestamp export.", details: ["Smart AI analysis", "Timeline markers", "Color coding", "Auto gap detection"], }, { icon: Zap, title: "Auto Zoom", description: "Automatic zoom animations at emphasis points.", details: ["3 frequency levels", "3 intensity presets", "Sentence/keyword placement", "Marker export"], }, { icon: Youtube, title: "YouTube Generator", description: "Generate SEO-optimized descriptions, titles, and shorts metadata.", details: ["Description with timestamps", "Multiple title options", "Shorts/TikTok/Reels metadata"], }, { icon: FileText, title: "Caption Export", description: "Export captions in multiple formats.", details: ["SRT subtitles", "VTT web format", "Plain text", "JSON with timing"], }, { icon: Wand2, title: "Custom Presets", description: "Create, save, and share your editing presets.", details: ["6 built-in presets", "Create custom presets", "Import/export JSON", "Duplicate & modify"], }, ]; const presets = [ { name: "Podcast", sensitivity: 35, minSilence: "0.8s", jCut: true, desc: "Natural pauses, conversational" }, { name: "Interview", sensitivity: 50, minSilence: "0.5s", jCut: true, desc: "Balanced Q&A rhythm" }, { name: "Reaction", sensitivity: 70, minSilence: "0.3s", jCut: false, desc: "Fast-paced, tight cuts" }, { name: "Tutorial", sensitivity: 30, minSilence: "1.0s", jCut: true, desc: "Preserve teaching pace" }, { name: "Vlog", sensitivity: 65, minSilence: "0.35s", jCut: false, desc: "Punchy YouTube edits" }, { name: "Custom", sensitivity: "-", minSilence: "-", jCut: false, desc: "User-defined settings" }, ]; export default function FeaturesPage() { return (

1→"use client"; 2→ 3→import { motion } from "framer-motion"; 4→import { Card, CardContent } from "@/components/ui/card"; 5→import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; 6→import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; 7→import { 8→ Accordion, 9→ AccordionContent, 10→ AccordionItem, 11→ AccordionTrigger, 12→} from "@/components/ui/accordion"; 13→import { 14→ ArrowLeft, 15→ ArrowRight, 16→ HelpCircle, 17→ AlertTriangle, 18→ Download, 19→ Key, 20→ Volume2, 21→ Settings, 22→ Monitor, 23→ Zap, 24→ Mail, 25→ MessageCircle, 26→} from "lucide-react"; 27→import Link from "next/link"; 28→import { Header } from "@/components/landing/Header"; 29→import { Footer } from "@/components/landing/Footer"; 30→ 31→interface FAQItem { 32→ question: string; 33→ answer: string; 34→} 35→ 36→interface FAQCategory { 37→ title: string; 38→ icon: React.ComponentType<{ className?: string }>; 39→ items: FAQItem[]; 40→} 41→ 42→const faqCategories: FAQCategory[] = [ 43→ { 44→ title: "Getting Started", 45→ icon: Download, 46→ items: [ 47→ { 48→ question: "Which version should I download: UXP or CEP?", 49→ answer: "We recommend the CEP version for its proven stability and wide compatibility across all Premiere Pro versions (14.0-25.9). If you prefer the modern architecture, you can use the UXP version for Premiere Pro 25.6+.", 50→ }, 51→ { 52→ question: "Do I need to enable anything special for the plugin to work?", 53→ answer: "For UXP, you need Adobe's UXP Developer Tool to load the plugin. For CEP, you need to enable unsigned extensions by running 'defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1' in Terminal (Mac) or adding a registry key (Windows). Restart Premiere Pro after making changes.", 54→ }, 55→ { 56→ question: "The plugin doesn't appear in Window > Extensions. What do I do?", 57→ answer: "First, ensure you've restarted Premiere Pro completely (not just the project). For CEP, verify you've enabled PlayerDebugMode and copied files to the correct extensions folder. For UXP, ensure the plugin is loaded via UXP Developer Tool.", 58→ }, 59→ { 60→ question: "How do I update to a new version?", 61→ answer: "Download the latest version from the download page. For UXP, reload the plugin in UXP Developer Tool. For CEP, replace the files in your extensions folder and restart Premiere Pro.", 62→ }, 63→ ], 64→ }, 65→ { 66→ title: "License & Billing", 67→ icon: Key, 68→ items: [ 69→ { 70→ question: "How do I activate my license?", 71→ answer: "Open SPLICE from Window > Extensions > SPLICE. Click the settings icon (gear) in the top right, then click 'Activate License'. Enter your license key and click Activate. Your license is activated instantly.", 72→ }, 73→ { 74→ question: "Can I use my license on multiple computers?", 75→ answer: "Yes! Your license can be activated on up to 2 computers simultaneously. To deactivate a computer, contact support@splice.app.", 76→ }, 77→ { 78→ question: "What happens if I exceed my monthly hours?", 79→ answer: "You can continue using SPLICE with overage charges at $1/hour. Overages are billed at the end of your billing cycle. You'll see a warning when you're approaching your limit.", 80→ }, 81→ { 82→ question: "How do I cancel my subscription?", 83→ answer: "Log in to your account at splice.app/account and click 'Cancel Subscription'. Your access continues until the end of your billing period. Contact support if you need assistance.", 84→ }, 85→ { 86→ question: "I lost my license key. How do I recover it?", 87→ answer: "Visit splice.app/recover or use the 'Forgot License Key' option in the plugin. Enter the email you used to purchase, and we'll send your key immediately.", 88→ }, 89→ ], 90→ }, 91→ { 92→ title: "Silence Detection", 93→ icon: Volume2, 94→ items: [ 95→ { 96→ question: "SPLICE is removing too much. How do I adjust?", 97→ answer: "Lower the sensitivity slider (30-40 is good for podcasts). Also increase the 'Minimum Silence Duration' to only remove longer pauses. Try the 'Podcast' or 'Tutorial' presets for more conservative removal.", 98→ }, 99→ { 100→ question: "SPLICE isn't removing enough silence. What should I do?", 101→ answer: "Increase sensitivity to 60-70 and reduce minimum silence duration. The 'Vlog' or 'Reaction' presets are more aggressive. Make sure your audio levels are consistent.", 102→ }, 103→ { 104→ question: "Why are some silences not being detected?", 105→ answer: "If there's background noise, hum, or music, those won't be detected as silence. Try using Vocal Isolation first (Pro tier) to clean the audio. Also check that your audio isn't too quiet overall.", 106→ }, 107→ { 108→ question: "Can I preview before applying changes?", 109→ answer: "Yes! After clicking GO, review the waveform visualization where green = speech and red = silence. You can adjust settings and re-analyze before clicking 'Build Sequence'.", 110→ }, 111→ ], 112→ }, 113→ { 114→ title: "Performance", 115→ icon: Zap, 116→ items: [ 117→ { 118→ question: "SPLICE is running slowly. How can I speed it up?", 119→ answer: "SPLICE processes audio in 30-second chunks for efficiency. For very long videos (1+ hours), processing may take a few minutes. Ensure you have a stable internet connection as analysis happens in the cloud.", 120→ }, 121→ { 122→ question: "How long does analysis take?", 123→ answer: "Typically 10-30 seconds for a 10-minute video. Longer videos take proportionally longer. AI music generation takes 2-5 minutes. Progress is shown in the panel.", 124→ }, 125→ { 126→ question: "SPLICE crashed Premiere Pro. What happened?", 127→ answer: "This is rare but can happen with very large projects. Try closing other panels, saving your project, and restarting Premiere Pro. If it persists, please report the issue with your system specs.", 128→ }, 129→ ], 130→ }, 131→ { 132→ title: "Features", 133→ icon: Settings, 134→ items: [ 135→ { 136→ question: "How do I use J-Cuts?", 137→ answer: "Enable J-Cut in your preset settings. Set 'Lead-in' (audio starts before video) and 'Lead-out' (audio ends after video). The 'Podcast' and 'Interview' presets have J-Cut enabled by default.", 138→ }, 139→ { 140→ question: "Can I use SPLICE with multicam sequences?", 141→ answer: "Yes! Use the Multitrack feature for multi-speaker recordings. Configure speakers, assign video tracks, and SPLICE will automatically switch based on who's talking.", 142→ }, 143→ { 144→ question: "How accurate is the AI take detection?", 145→ answer: "Very accurate for typical recording patterns. For best results, pause clearly between takes (2+ seconds) or say 'Take 1, Take 2' before each take.", 146→ }, 147→ { 148→ question: "Is the AI-generated music royalty-free?", 149→ answer: "Yes! All music generated by SPLICE is royalty-free for commercial use. You own the output and can use it in monetized videos without additional licensing.", 150→ }, 151→ { 152→ question: "Can I customize the animated caption templates?", 153→ answer: "Yes! You can adjust colors, font sizes, animation timing, and more. You can also modify the template CSS directly for advanced customization.", 154→ }, 155→ ], 156→ }, 157→ { 158→ title: "Compatibility", 159→ icon: Monitor, 160→ items: [ 161→ { 162→ question: "Which versions of Premiere Pro are supported?", 163→ answer: "CEP version: Premiere Pro 14.0-25.9 (2020-2025). ### Detailed Findings

#### Issue #1: Pricing Page Inconsistency (Priority: High)

**File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-website/src/app/pricing/page.tsx`

**Problem**: The pricing page still contains urgency elements (countdown timer, "spots left") that were supposed to be removed according to CLAUDE.md Session 8 notes:

Lines 46, 74, 102: `spotsLeft` property still present in plan objects
Lines 163-189: `UrgencyCountdown` component still defined
Lines 226-230: Countdown timer still rendered in UI
Lines 280-291: "Only X beta spots left" still displayed

According to CLAUDE.md:
> "Phase 2 Conversion Optimization: Removed fake urgency from Pricing.tsx: No more countdown timer or 'spots left' messaging"

However, the pricing page still shows these elements. This is a discrepancy between documentation and implementation.

**Recommendation**: Verify whether these elements should be removed as documented, or update documentation to reflect current design decision.

---

#### Issue #2: Pricing Discrepancy in API Reference (Priority: Medium)

**File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-website/src/app/docs/api/page.tsx`

**Problem**: Lines 477-504 show different tier limits than CLAUDE.md:

| Tier | API Page | CLAUDE.md |
|------|----------|-----------|
| Starter | 12 hours, 5 music credits | 4 hours, 2 music credits |
| Pro | 30 hours, 20 music credits | 15 hours, 10 music credits |
| Team | 100 hours, 100 music credits | 50 hours, 50 music credits |

**Recommendation**: Align API documentation with actual pricing tiers.

---

#### Issue #3: Overage Rate Discrepancy (Priority: Low)

**File**: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-website/src/app/pricing/page.tsx`

Lines 107-111 show overage rates:
```javascript
{ item: "Processing hours", rate: "$2.00/hour" },
{ item: "Vocal isolation", rate: "$0.10/minute" },
{ item: "Music generation", rate: "$1.00/song" },
```

CLAUDE.md states:
- Processing hours: $2/hour (matches)
- Vocal isolation: $0.08/minute (discrepancy - page shows $0.10)
- Music generation: $1/song (matches)

**Recommendation**: Align vocal isolation rate with documented $0.08/minute.
